sections.purpose: To store reagents, kits, and samples at refrigerated temperatures (typically 2–8°C).
sections.scope: Applicable to general cold storage needs in the Microbiology laboratory.
procedure: Verify that the internal temperature is within the acceptable range.
Arrange items to allow airflow and avoid blocking vents.
Label all stored materials clearly with identity and date.
Record the temperature in the logbook at defined intervals.
Clean shelves and interior walls with a mild disinfectant periodically.
Defrost the unit if ice buildup interferes with operation.
Remove expired or unneeded items regularly following disposal SOPs.
precautions: Do not store food or beverages.
Minimize door openings to maintain temperature stability.
Do not store flammable solvents unless the unit is explosion-proof.
Ensure that the power supply is stable or backed up for critical items.
Check and maintain door seals in good condition.
